content: TOKYO, May 9 (Reuters) - Two major European asset managers have jointly filed a shareholder resolution at Japanese electricity generator Electric Power Development Co Ltd , known as J-Power, for the second consecutive year in a row.

Amundi and HSBC Asset Management filed the resolution with the Australasian Centre for Corporate Responsibility (ACCR), the non-profit climate group said in a statement on Tuesday.The resolution is supported by Man Group, the world's largest publicly traded hedge fund, ACCR said. (Reporting by Makiko Yamazaki; Editing by Tom Hogue)
